page.title: 03Ecology: Rosneath
page.content: Rosneath situated between sea and hills and forest behind it. There are walks through most of forest which walkers take to Trig Point at Clach Mackenny, one of highest parts at over 200m. One walk is the Adam & Eve. Name comes from 2 silver firs planted be- fore l700 which grew to 25ft in cir- cumference and l30ft high. These be- came dangerous and cut down in l979 but Forestry Commission has carried on tradition by planting 2 silver firs called Cain & Abel. Parts of forest being sold off to private buyers.There are foxes, rabbits, deer, blackcock, jackdaws, jays, crows, rooks, buzzards hen harriers, kestrels, merlins, all common garden birds and great many sea birds. Once pair of Canada Geese were spotted on Lindowan Loch but some idiot shot them.
